bio:treatment.description: Stems (2–)10–29 cm. Leaves: petioles slender; blades 3-nerved, linear to narrowly oblanceolate or spatulate, 17–90 × (1.5–)3–7(–12) mm, bases attenuate, margins ciliolate, faces glabrous, gland-dotted, viscid. Heads 1–2(–4). 2n = 18.

verbatim.text: Flowering mid spring; fruiting early summer. High plains grasslands and badlands, sagebrush steppe, pinyon-juniper woodlands, sandstone and limestone soils; 700–2700 m; Sask.; Ariz., Colo., Kans., Mont., Nebr., N.Mex., N.Dak., S.Dak., Utah, Wyo.
